abstract: Hartford Police Dept and Charter Oak Cultural Center have teamed up to organize Good Vibrations, pilot program bringing together middle-school boys, mostly minorities, and police officers to participate in free music classes together; focus is on young males, who have been more likely in Hartford to have confrontations with police officers; program's goal is to foster relationships between officers and boys that will break down stereotypes on both sides and strengthen community overall (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: A pilot program brings middle-school boys and officers together to create music, while breaking down barriers and learning to trust one another.

headline.main: Hartford Police Officers Rap With Youths to Erode Stereotypes
headline.print_headline: Taking a Break From the Beat to Rap

snippet: A pilot program brings middle-school boys and officers together to create music, while breaking down barriers and learning to trust one another.
